item.title: 8 Best Slitherine Strategy Games
item.description:
Highlights

  • Slitherine Software excels in creating historically accurate and engaging strategy games in various genres like sci-fi and fantasy.
  • Games like Legion Arena and Gates of Troy showcase Slitherine's expertise in turn-based combat and strategic gameplay for players to enjoy.
  • From Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance to Fantasy General 2, Slitherine Software's diverse range of titles offer immersive and challenging experiences.

Slitherine Software is a British game developer and publisher company that has been commonly known for making a variety of strategy titles since the company was founded in 2000. Many fans of strategy and digital war games know Slitherine to be one of the leading companies for creating these sorts of titles.

While they mainly focus on historical warfare games, they have been known to take a dip into both the sci-fi and fantasy genres to create incredible real-time stretchy games in those environments. With so many games developed and published by Slitherine Software, these games are by far the best, as well as being the most memorable strategy titles for players to still enjoy.

8 Legion Arena

Metascore: 65

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2005-12-21
  • Developer: Slitherine Games
  • Genre(s): Strategy

Starting off with a classic from Slitherine Games, Legion Arena is a fond memory of many who enjoyed strategy games from the early 2000s. In Legion Arena , players are able to take control of some of the strongest units known throughout history, especially the powerful Roman army.

Legion Arena players can plan as many tactics as they want by planning how their units will attack even before the battle begins or simply going in with their weapons held high. Besides the set of units players can choose from, it is also up to the player to improve their army through various combat skills.

7 Gates of Troy

Metascore: 70

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2004-12-08
  • Developer: Slitherine Software
  • Genre(s): Strategy

Slitherine Software prides itself on creating historically accurate battle simulators and Gates of Troy was no different when it first released in 2004. As a combination of tactical battles from the historical times of Troy and an interesting campaign to go alongside it, the turn-based strategy gameplay of Gates of Troy was one of the many titles made by Slitherine that saw them pave the way for what players expect when playing the strategy genre.

Even many years after its original release, players still return to Gates of Troy to take part in the battles of countless Greek warriors and the battles they faced like the battle of Thermopylae.

6 Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance

Metascore: 72

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2024-02-21
  • Developer: Slitherine Software
  • Genre(s): Strategy

Set in the Terminator: Dark Fate universe, Defiance is a real-time strategy game that highlights the war between humanity and the Legion's intelligence machine network. Players need to work carefully in Terminator: Dark Fate - Defiance as their resources are limited, and the player must protect their army at all costs if they hope to have a fighting chance against the machines.

Even in a futuristic environment, Slitherine Software still values creating realistic warfare environments, and that includes explosions that play well with physics-based building demolition.

5 Stargate: Timekeepers

Metascore: 72

While Slitherine Games tend to have favored turn-based combat in their games, there are various tactical titles, such as Stargate: Timekeepers , where the strategy requires players to have quick thinking as the gameplay involves real-time tactics.

Players have a focused group of trained specialists that they must lead behind enemy lines in an assortment of interesting campaign missions. Each member of the team has their own unique abilities which players will need to learn so they can easily use those abilities together to tactfully complete stealth missions where every enemy is silently dealt with.

4 Field Of Glory 2: Medieval

Metascore: 75

  • Platform(s): PC
  • Released: 2021-02-04
  • Developer: Byzantine Games
  • Genre(s): Strategy

The Middle Ages is a ripe time in history for developers to explore tactical combat. Field of Glory 2: Medieval is one of many of these impressive games, though the turn-based strategy simulation title takes much of its inspiration from the tabletop world and puts it in a digital environment like the PC.

The setting of the medieval world even has a story to it, as Field of Glory 2 pays attention to the conflict between the kings of England and France, as well as the influence of German Emperors. Besides its story, Field of Glory 2 has some of the most accurate battle gameplay from the High Medieval Age and continues to be a staple published by the British company.

3 Battle Academy 2: Eastern Front

Metascore: 77

  • Platform(s): PC and IOS
  • Released: 2014-09-11
  • Developer: Slitherine Software
  • Genre(s): Strategy

This successful predecessor to the original Battle Academy takes the turn-based action to the east as players battle on the land of Mother Russia. Battle Academy 2: Eastern Front received an all-new look in 2014, as players praised its gritty appearance and assortment of new features to keep players entertained.

Besides the multiplayer features that allow players to fight between themselves with various Soviet units, the solo campaign is another interesting strategy adventure, as players can get stuck into four separate campaigns with an abundance of missions.

2 Battlestar Galatica: Deadlock

Metascore: 77

Besides Slitherine Software developing an assortment of strategy games, they have also been known to support other developers that have published under their banner to create other interesting themes for strategy titles. Battlestar Galatica: Deadlock is one of many sci-fi strategy games, though it is arguably one of the best to be connected to Slitherine.

Players take on control of a colonial fleet that hopes to defend the Twelve Colonies during the First Cyclon War. Controlling various ships in space through turn-based gameplay makes every decision the player chooses incredibly vital to their success.

1 Fantasy General 2: Invasion

Metascore: 80

Out of all the strategy games to be published by Slitherine Software, Fantasy General 2: Invasion has been deemed as one of the best games to be developed and published by a British gaming company. Many players of turn-based strategy games were thrilled to see the return of this strategy classic.

As the player levels up and trains their various fantasy-themed units, they lead them through a campaign filled with destruction. Players are sure to find a variety of ways to plan tactical warfare, with over 75 units to choose from and a variety of interesting battlefields to fight on too.

item.title: Shadow of the Erdtree: How to Get Hornsent Set & Caterpillar Mask
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Hornsent Armor Set Overview: Pieces & Stats
  • Where To Find Hornsent Armor Set Location

Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree, like most FromSoftware games, features a few armor sets that are essentially too weird to pass up. Some outfits are so bizarre, that players can't help but want to wear the set themselves. In the Elden Ring DLC, the Hornsent Set and Caterpillar Mask are definitely near the top of the 'weird' list. Still, there's no denying it's an interesting set, and offers some unique benefits beyond its appearance. This guide will explain how players can get the Hornsent Set, which includes the Caterpillar Mask, in Shadow of the Erdtree.

Hornsent Armor Set Overview: Pieces & Stats

In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , the Hornsent armor set is made up of four pieces: the Braided Cord Robe , Braided Arm Wraps , Soiled Loincloth , and the Caterpillar Mask . When all four pieces are equipped, the Hornsent set weight is 7.1.

The Hornsent Set is the exact set you see the Hornsent wearing throughout Shadow of the Erdtree 's main story. It is made up of mostly rags and braided rope cords. While this does not offer much in the way of protection, it is extremely light. The entire set weighs less than many single pieces of heavier armor. For those players that have mastered the art of evasion, the Hornsent set will be a perfect fit. The Hornsent Set's only real protective strength is its overall Focus level. This makes it a good set for players wanting to avoid Madness buildup. Overall, its non-physical damage negation is decent, on par with the better sets in the weight class, but it does not greatly excel in any one area.

Special Enhancements:

Enhances both watchful spirits and the vengeful spirits summoned by horned bairns.

Hornsent Set Body Armor Piece: Braided Cord Robe

Damage Negation:

Where To Find Hornsent Armor Set Location

To get the Hornsent Set in Shadow of the Erdtree , you must follow the Hornsent's quest, at least up to a certain point. There are several points in Shadow of the Erdtree where you can get the Hornsent Set, but they all involve reaching distinct points in either the Hornsent's quest, or Needle Knight Leda's quest. You'll first encounter the Hornsent at the Three-Path Cross, where they give you the first map to Miquella's Crosses. Eventually, they'll move to the Highroad Cross in Scadu Altus, where you can give them the Scorpion Stew. The Shadow Keep, however, is where things can take a turn.

If you speak to Needle Knight Leda at Highroad Cross after Miquella's Charm has been broken, you'll begin to see her change. She no longer trusts many of those around her. The Hornsent is at the top of her list, and she wants to kill them. This leads to a summon sign being found in the Shadow Keep, which allows you to either assist Leda in killing the Hornsent, or assist the Hornsent in the fight against Leda. If you assist Leda, you will get the Hornsent Set when the Hornsent dies . However, if you assist the Hornsent, you'll have to wait until later to get their gear.

After assisting the Hornsent, you will be able to summon them during the fight against Messmer the Impaler . Once that fight is over, you will not see the Hornsent again until the very end of the Ancient Ruins of Rauh. In that region, your goal is to reach the Church of the Bud. Just before the church, you'll encounter a large chamber filled with liquid rot and red pests. There is a long ramp that leads up to the Church of the Bud. As you make your way up the ramp, the Hornsent will invade you. Defeat them here to get the Hornsent Set and Falx, their dual curved swords.

If you do not summon the Hornsent to fight Messmer, and you did not assist Leda, you will still be able to get the set later in Enir-Ilum. Near the end of that section, you'll fight Leda and her Allies. At the end of that fight, you'll find the Hornsent among the dead. You can collect the set then.

item.title: Roblox: Speed Runner Codes (July 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Speed Runner Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Speed Runner
  • How to Get More Speed Runner Codes

There are plenty of great obstacle platformers on Roblox , but few can compete with Arcade Gaming's Speed Runner when it comes to longevity. More than a quarter of a billion people have played the game since its launch, many of whom remain regular players to this day.

There are tons of stages for players to enjoy, although some can be a little tricky to navigate. Roblox players looking to give themselves a leg up should therefore consider using Speed Runner! codes, as the coins they provide can be used to purchase Mutators that can make runs much easier.

Speed Runner Codes

All Working Speed Runner Codes

  • 60KLIKES - Redeem code to get 100 Coins (NEW)
  • SEASON1 - Redeem code to get 100 Coins

All Expired Speed Runner Codes

  • 20KLIKES - Redeem code to get 100 Coins

How to Redeem Codes for Speed Runner

Those hoping to redeem codes for Speed Runner! are in luck, as the process for doing so is remarkably simple. Like in a lot of other Roblox games, players will just need to press a few buttons: a process that can be carried out right from the get-go due to the game not having a tutorial. For anyone having trouble, though, or players who are new to the platform, the following step-by-step instructions should prove useful.

  1. Launch Speed Runner .
  2. Open the Settings menu by clicking the grey gear icon on the left side of the screen.
  3. Type or paste a working Speed Runner! code into the " Enter reward code... " box at the bottom of the menu.
  4. Click the blue Redeem button to claim your reward.

How to Get More Speed Runner Codes

The best place to find all of the latest Speed Runner! codes is right here, as we'll update this guide whenever new codes become available for the game. Players may also want to think about joining the developer's group if they haven't already, as new Roblox promo codes are sometimes published there as well.

  • Arcade Gaming Roblox Group

item.title: Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord - How To Sell Prisoners
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Prisoners In Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord
  • How To Sell Prisoners In Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord
  • How To Recruit & Donate Prisoners In Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord will have players fighting massive armies which will often lead to the deaths of hundreds of troops on both sides. When a soldier from the opposing army falls in battle, there is a chance they can be claimed as a prisoner after the battle.

There are a few things that can be done with prisoners, and it is recommended to always claim prisoners when you can up to the maximum amount your party can hold. The rewards for claiming prisoners are directly tied to the tier of that soldier, making it important to take the strongest soldiers and lords first.

How To Get Prisoners In Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord


Your total prisoner count is determined by:

  • +10 base value
  • +2 for every party member

After finishing a battle, you'll get the chance to talk to any lord from the opposing side that you just defeated. While they can be set free, it's in your best interest to always take these lords prisoner . Next, you'll get the screen where you can recruit any troops from the army who wish to join you and take any prisoners from the section below.

In the bottom right of your screen will be the maximum amount of prisoners your party can hold, and going over will lead to some prisoners escaping. After a lord's health regenerates a bit, they are also able to escape from your party . Regular soldiers will stay prisoners until you choose what to do with them.

How To Sell Prisoners In Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

To sell a prisoner, head to the nearest city that has a Tavern . In the tavern menu, there will be the options to, "Ransom your prisoners" or, "Choose the prisoners to be ransomed". The amount of money earned by ransoming a soldier is determined by their tier, with higher-tier soldiers being sold for a lot more than recruits. Lords can also be sold for more than a dozen elite soldiers, but this will still lead to them escaping and rejoining their faction after just a few short days.

Holding onto a lord for a few days will also lead to a courier arriving with a ransom for the lord, and it will often be for more than they are sold for , but will also lead to them rejoining a war much quicker. Lords can also be executed, but the ramifications for this may be more than you want to deal with.

How To Recruit & Donate Prisoners In Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord


As prisoners stay in your party, they will eventually be able to be recruited for free . The amount of time it takes for a prisoner to be recruited varies from soldier to soldier slightly, with it also taking higher-tier units much longer to be recruited. A list of your prisoners can be found at the bottom of your party menu, with a small yellow icon appearing next to the number of that unit when they are ready to be recruited.

Prisoners can also be donated to the dungeon in a castle or city of your faction for influence . The reward for influence is determined by the tier of the soldier, but either way, the total return of influence with this method is fairly low.

item.title: Xbox 360 Fan Buys Used Console And Gets an Incredible Surprise
item.description:
Highlights

  • A bonus copy of Need for Speed: Most Wanted (2005) was found in a used Xbox 360 Elite console.
  • The game sells for anywhere from $25 to $60 on Ebay, so it's a great find.
  • Prices of Xbox 360 games are expected to increase as Microsoft plans to shut down the digital storefront on July 29.

An Xbox 360 fan found a copy of Need for Speed: Most Wanted when they opened their used Elite console's disc tray. Microsoft released multiple Xbox 360 variations over the course of the console's lifespan. The initial batch of Xbox 360 consoles were not exactly the most well-made machines, with the Red Ring of Death causing over half of them to stop working.

Microsoft eventually released revamped Xbox 360 consoles without the dreaded defects that plagued its original batch of consoles. One such Xbox 360 re-release was the Elite console, which came a couple of years into the 360's lifespan and came bundled with a 120 GB hard drive, significant storage space for the time. The Xbox 360 Elite console became a favorite among gamers for its hard drive and matte black design.

Recently, Reddit user Minute_Piece8984 purchased an Xbox 360 Elite console. They didn't specify how much they paid for the console, but when they opened its disc tray, they found a loose copy of Need for Speed: Most Wanted inside. For the uninitiated, Need for Speed: Most Wanted is the 2005 Need for Speed game and a launch title for the 360. Need for Speed: Most Wanted earned high reviews from critics at the time of its release. The game is not available to purchase digitally through the Xbox 360 marketplace, which has caused the price of its physical copies to go up. Ebay listings show that the game goes for anywhere from $25 to $60, making this a great surprise bonus to go along with the Elite console.

Gamer Finds Surprise Copy of Need for Speed: Most Wanted in Xbox 360 Elite Console

Unfortunately, it's likely that the prices of all Xbox 360 games will be going up soon. Microsoft is shutting down the Xbox 360 digital storefront on July 29, at which point some games will be lost forever and others will likely see a big price increase for their physical versions. As a matter of fact, there's data indicating that Xbox 360 game prices are already going up, which is bad news for collectors or anyone that is itching to take a trip down memory lane by picking up some old 360 titles.

The good news is that there are many Xbox 360 games that are playable on modern consoles, and those will remain available for purchase even after the 360 marketplace shuts down on July 29. Need for Speed: Most Wanted isn't among them, which is a shame, but hopefully the fan favorite game makes a comeback of some kind down the road.
